If you write with empty space in between, inside JSP(X) Document (XML syntax) tomcat translates this into (X)HTML output IMHO this is incorrect behavior and output shoudl not be self closing tag <title/> but <title> if not . ------------------------------------- Please consider these specs: http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/#C_3 C.3. Element Minimization and Empty Element Content Given an empty instance of an element whose content model is not EMPTY (for example, an empty title or paragraph) do not use the minimized form (e.g. use

and not

). also this: C.2. Empty Elements Include a space before the trailing / and > of empty elements, e.g.
,

and . Also, use the minimized tag syntax for empty elements, e.g.
, as the alternative syntax

allowed by XML gives uncertain results in many existing user agents. and also this: JSP.1.3.4 Empty Elements As examples, the following are all empty tags: <%-- any comment --%> While the following are all non-empty tags: <%= expression %> <% scriptlet %> ---------------
